channel.title: TF2 and HL2 content
channel.description:
Hi
Sometimes when I'm mapping for TF2, I need to use something from the HL2 content. This might be a sound or a texture or model that TF2 is missing that the map is needing. The question for this thread is:
Do I really need to pakrat the HL2 content into the bsp so that the users who only have purchased TF2 can see/hear the non-tf2 content that originated from the HL2 files?
*TF2 = Team Fortress 2 *HL2 = Half-Life 2

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
In Hammer, any textures sounds and models that are available (ie: you can see them and select them) you can use.

If you’re mapping for TF2 you will have all the HL2 textures and sounds available aswell. It seems counter-intuitive because HL2 stuff wouldn’t “fit” in TF2, but the Source 2007 gcfs are included with and shared by all Orange Box engine games for modders/mappers to use freely (portal, ep2, tf2, dod :s ).

Don’t ask for evidence, try it yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content
item.dc:creator: Tenshi07
item.description:
Is there any evidence to support this? That’s pretty much all I care about. And thanks btw.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
You can use HL2 content in TF2 freely without any problems. If someone has TF2 installed, they will have all the Source 2007 .GCFs installed aswell. Same applies to DoD:S, CS:S, Portal etc… You don’t need to add anything to the .BSP

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content
item.dc:creator: Tornronim
item.description:
Metritutus:

I thought that (say, if you own Counter-Stike: Source I think you also get Half-Life 2 content, say props etcetera) but I cannot say that with any real certainty as I own Team Fortress 2, Half-Life 2 and Counter-Strike: Source.

Well after just checking you can indeed use HL2 content in TF2, or Hammer’s special and it doesn’t actually work ingame.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
Tornronim:

I believe all source games have the base HL2 content mounted, so I’m fairly sure anyone who has TF2 has access to the HL2 content.

I thought that (say, if you own Counter-Stike: Source I think you also get Half-Life 2 content, say props etcetera) but I cannot say that with any real certainty as I own Team Fortress 2, Half-Life 2 and Counter-Strike: Source.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content
item.dc:creator: Tornronim
item.description:
I believe all source games have the base HL2 content mounted, so I’m fairly sure anyone who has TF2 has access to the HL2 content.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
Extract the necessary files using GCF Scape, located here:

https://nemesis.thewavelength.net/index.php?p=25

Then use Pakrat to embed the files into your compiled map BSP file:

https://www.geocities.com/cofrdrbob/pakrat.html

It’s all reasonably self-explanatory. It’s quite easy to test if your stuff is working too, either move your Half-Life 2 gcf files to another location but do not re-download them, or have some kind friend (who you trust) who does not own Half-Life 2 to test your map.

There are other utilities that can do this, but Pakrat is the one I found easiest to use. There is no other way.

Read full topic

item.title: TF2 and HL2 content

item.description:
HE HAS IT.
THE PEOPLE HE’S MAPPING FOR DON’T ALL HAVE IT.
IT’S REALLY VERY SIMPLE.
